Appointed Chairman of Tata Trusts, Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata Noel Tata has been appointed as the new Chairman of Tata Trusts, effective October 11, following the death of his half-brother Ratan Tata on October 9 at the age of 86.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Mehli Mistry, Noel Tata lead race to become Tata Trusts chairman: ReportNoel Tata is already a trustee in the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust, which together hold a 66% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Baba Siddique murder: Mumbai cops say contract killing, search on for mastermindNCP leader and former Maharashtra minister Baba Siddique was shot dead by three men in Mumbai's Bandra area on Saturday.

Baba Siddique's iftar and SRK-Salman patch-up: It was Allah, I had no roleBaba Siddique was known for his close ties with Bollywood's biggest stars, including Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan. He played a pivotal role in ending the Khans' five-year-long feud.

Ground Report: Displaced Lebanese see no end to conflict amid Israeli bombingLebanese citizens, internally displaced and now living in relief camps, do not see a swift end to the Israel-Hezbollah war. India Today reports from South Beirut.

Former Delhi University professor GN Saibaba dies at 54 GN Saibaba, a former Delhi University professor, died at a state-run hospital on Saturday due to post-operative complications. The 57-year-old's death comes seven months after his acquittal in a case involving alleged Maoist links.

Sweating and sneezing: How October heat is fuelling a health crisis in IndiaEarlier, October marked the transition between seasons, and was a month of mild weather and festivities. However, a rise in global temperatures and a shift in weather patterns have given rise to October heat. And October heat has become a serious health risk, with hospitals in several cities flooded.

Live: State funeral for NCP's Baba Siddique, cops identify third shooterBaba Siddique Murder News Live: Former Maharashtra minister and Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Baba Siddique was shot dead by three men in Mumbai's Bandra area on Saturday. Siddique, 66, was attacked outside the office of his son, MLA Zeeshan Siddique, and later succumbed to his injuries at Lilavati Hospital. Two suspects have been arrested, while a third remains at large. The murder of Siddique, a prominent leader who served three terms as the MLA from Bandra (West), comes as the state is likely to hold assembly elections soon. Political leaders across parties expressed shock and condemnation, with NCP chief Ajit Pawar and Chief Minister Eknath Shinde both vowing a thorough investigation. Opposition leaders, including Congress' Balasaheb Thorat and Shiv Sena's Aaditya Thackeray, also voiced concerns about the state's security, calling it a collapse of the administration. Siddique had joined the Ajit Pawar-led NCP faction earlier this year after leaving Congress.
